Fw5b7MKU4tNXa9hV5kRHTA.text: Our waiter was unfriendly and inattentive. He would not come check on us until we actively sought him out. The table near us had great service, though. The appetizers were okay, but the main entrees were overcooked. The meat was very chewy. The owner stopped by and was very nice.

Dy02kt8F6cF_6sPkRcxK1A.text: I enjoyed eating here a while back and my last experience was just as good. Lunchtime was a little quiet, great for me as I have hearing issues.  More importantly, the food was delicious.  My companion ordered a kebab sandwich which he said, was perfectly spiced, although it came with a small house garden salad he also ordered a side of tabouli salad.  Being vegetarian, I ordered the eggplant moussaka, more like a good stew, served over rice with a side salad. The desert though, may just have been the highlight of of the meal.  The Beirut Nights was excellent.  A huge,  cold creamy dish, topped with just the right America of rose water, chopped pistachios and a syrup that wasn't too sweet.  The staff were friendly  Service was a little slow but the staff were friendly and our server was attentive and accommodating. I wish I lived closer to Tempe !

4AJvVUXkaatSSpkxGGzhyg.text: Sat for 45 mins - only got a glass of water and an appetizer - server was completely overwhelmed - only one person working the dining room. Left hungry and ill-treated.

10jLqr-IByhoxT27wscPFw.text: The sides were very good but the chicken and beef were over cooked.  The service was slow but the waitress was friendly.  The owner was around but didn't talk to us or ask how our meal was.  Too bad as this could be a decent restaurant.  I gave it 3 stars but it is close to 2 stars.

nmmUKKEEPrFTfGTOSYougQ.text: Friday is probably the best day to come - if you want more than just a good meal - because you can also watch a free belly dancing show at 7:30pm and then stay for  Tumbao, Latin Friday's from 9pm-2am with an included group dance lesson 9:30-10:30 and posible performance at 11pm with the $10 cover charge. The place gets PACKED!

pbJmYl4fcw2iGvWKigQzfg.text: The best part of this experience was the belly dancers at dinner.  We went with family and had a good time.  The belly dancers will take volunteers from the restaurant, which was a surprise to some of us.  The waitress seemed confused - on start time of dancing, yelp offer of free hummus with check in and on menu items.  The hummus was actually delicious, as was the bread.  I tried the swordfish and did not care for it.  It was not the best cut - very fatty.  Also it came with a salad that seemed to have Kraft Italian dressing on it.  Half of our group loved the food and the other half did not.  I guess it is hit and miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Looking forward to belly dancing

lSv5CtdQiF5LOIPd9uCG0w.text: Ordered the kafta and falafel sandwiches thru Uber eats. Food arrived cold and super dry. There was also a hair strand in one of the pita wraps. Tahini sauce was little to none which made the sandwiches super dry. Kafta had no taste and presentation as a whole was subpar.

BFTykQKKN5JxjrKRgp7qPg.text: Mijana is an exciting place. I went on a Friday evening for their music event and, while I was planning on staying until 10, I hung around until almost 2 am. The vibes are great and the food! OMG, the food!

Cs0vfkPwkhf5dTyOsna4JA.text: I liked the ethnic music. Two waitresses welcomed us with smiles and patience. The lentil soup and babaganush ( kind of Smokey) were both very good. My partner had nicely spiced chicken schmarma with flavorful rice and a good salad. We were very pleased.

prs_K-K6vI8wCSHlFgBFNw.text: Mijana is hands down my favorite Mediterranean place!  I go with my daughter all the time and we love the food, the belly dancers on the weekends, and the owner always stops by and asks how everything was.  It's not a quick in-and-out sort of place, but that's bc they make everything fresh to order.  Some of these other reviews are ridiculous in their expectations.  Mijana is a place to go sit and enjoy an amazing meal with friends or family.  So no, do not expect the servers to be at your beck and call every 5 minutes.  We usually get the same few servers and they are very pleasant and friendly.  They remember us and where we like to sit, and what we usually order.  Anyway, their shwarma here is the best I've ever had!  The bread is also the BEST!  Mijana is one of my favorite restaurants in the valley.  If you like Mediterranean, check them out!

iisTPlgxOYRploU-u5B5YA.text: I went on a Saturday night using a groupon and was asked to leave before 10pm when the entertainment starts because the coupon didn't cover the cost to see the dancers.  Slow service, okay tasting food and very loud area because they were scraping chairs across the floor to get ready for the dancers.  They cater to the their ethnic group.  The short rude male waiter sucks! In more ways than one.

ZnPOffkPr3QTF3TAwx8z9Q.text: Food is really good, great flavor, good mixed drinks from the bar! I'd definitely eat from here again but only if it was takeout or delivery.    The two servers were working probably 5-7 tables at the time. They were acting as: Hosts, hookah coordinators, DJ, servers, bartenders, takeout/delivery order takers, etc. They need more staff in my opinion. As a result the service was pretty cold and very slow.   It took way longer for us to eat than I think it should have but it's not really their fault for the restaurant understaffing.

VsfOJTqV4Va_g5pM0XqqOg.text: Solid Lebanese place. It's a restaurant but they also offer hookah, and there's entertainment on the weekends which includes belly dancing and salsa night. There's also live music certain nights, everything is on their event calendar on their website. They give complimentary fresh pita bread with a Za'atar and olive oil mixture. I ordered the Sujuk which is spicy beef sausage and it came with tomatoes, it was delicious.  I came on a Friday night and there was a belly dancing show from 7:45 to 8:15, quite impressive that it was 30 minutes long. The belly dancer is also interactive with the audience, so she might choose you to come up and dance with her. There's strobe lights, Lebanese music, overall a great and lively experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sujuk with tomatoes, and Za&#39;atar and olive oil with pita bread.

IqKOhM28-2WFI6cN5khE3A.text: I went with a group of friends for the Lebanese cooking class...and it was okay. We were expecting it to be a hands-on class where we cook the dishes as well. Instead, it was us watching the cooking instructor make the different dishes (hummus, baba ghanoush, tabouleh, chicken shawarma). At the completion of each dish, the server served us that dish. It was nice to have a taste of it all and to know what the end products should taste like haha. The chicken shawarma meat was dry and not as enjoyable as it could have been. I've tasted better middle eastern food elsewhere (Haji baba).   The place looked like it needed a face lift when I walked in. It looked ancient and dry. The owner seemed down to earth when he introduced himself to us and gave us background on Lebanese culture and the food.

LrlhHMNF1hSu1h_uNje0aw.text: This place is way too loud and way to expensive. They charge ten bucks each person for a cover just to enter. Their food is not that great. Ordered some tabolee and was very bitter. The greek salad was okay. The waitress was beyond slow. My sister and her husband got a menu and were never served. The music was way too loud and music selection was way too old. I will not be coming back.

C6j84TjDhrcf0CrK0NuEwA.text: Best Lebanese Food and Shawarma Ever!  We found this place through a Groupon deal and I like Lebanese food so of course I was ready to try this spot out! After years of eating here now and this is my favorite restaurant now!  Jalapeno Hummus is a nice way to start off! Great flavor and just the right amount of spicy to it! Delicious!  The Shawarma Combo is the most wonderful explosion of wondrous flavor ever! I eat lots of shawarma and even make my own. The combo for two is quite exceptional to the point of being rather excellent, quite possibly even outstanding!  I get the pot of Turkish coffee and the tiramisu for desert for the best finale ever.   Good music everyday....   Live belly dancing Friday and Saturday nights makes an event out of dining!  They have a bar here if you want to get your drink on....  Stop by and tell them Vladimir sent you!

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tiramisu and Turkish coffee pot for desert!
Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shawarma Combo for 2
Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States

8vn0H1q-PickW7QY8WIgJA.text: Love this place . My all time favorite . Combo player for two will feed three for sure . Service always great ... ambiance peaceful .

BzCBhiSr_AeYyWgmjbxtJQ.text: Amazing food, great hospitality, and amazing customer service! Highly recommend this place

OCmt6bbhA1WSyja6u8kn3w.text: This was my first time trying Lebanese cuisine and it was a great place to have my first experience. Hands down, the hummus was perfect. The others at my table agreed, we would smear the hummus on anything and everything because it is so tastey. My fiance and I shared the chicken and beef schwarma and the dish did not disappoint.  The group also had a few appetizers and they came out fresh and nicely displayed, and it was a great introduction for our meal. My favorite was the Turkish Coffee. It was divine and a True treat to have.  I will certainly visit this restaurant in the future.

6W8SAZQT2VDIjx_ULFasWA.text: Delicious and fresh food!  Great service, they were able to accomodate our group of 20 with separate checks, and the belly dancer was amazing!

Wy7LaOFwVvDUYWoDf1s0ew.text: Great ambience, REALLY friendly staff, reasonable prices and delicious food with generous portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great ambience and great middle eastern music! Nice place to chill

Z5pqujHhkiXhH6ztRBNMWw.text: I admit I was brought here by Groupon and a friend who was "pining" for middle eastern fare. I became concerned when I realized that the hookah shop was attached to the restaurant, and all the wait staff and cooks were wearing hookah T shirts. I am not a huge fan of the hookah but I have friends who are and depending what you hookah, you may or may not be able to do your job well. The waitress, who was scarce though there were only six patrons in the place, recommended the schwarma. I got the beef, friend ate the chicken. Sorry, but ugh. The tabouleh was 99% gritty parsley. So bitter hard to eat. Mine was not much more than little pieces of stir-fried meat with no flavor, then some no flavor rice. The reason for the two stars is the bread, pita style, that came with the hummus which was good. I could have been happy with just that. Wish I had. Then the poor service and the waitress who added 9$ to our check and when we showed her the discrepancy, said "just give me what you owe me". instead of recalculating which tells me: either she can't add, doesn't care, or has been to the hookah shop. My advice, skip this go for the hookah...

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Swarms
Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States

rUN64KJ50UWVHnv5_RTdzQ.text: I've dined here with my family several times.  The food is plentiful and delicious.  Love watching the belly dancers on Friday and Saturday nights, they really make the whole experience a delight!  Portions are huge, love the fatoush, but one order can feed three, lol. The beef kabobs were a delight, however we asked for them to be rare, and they were medium at best.  The rice was wonderful and the pita bread is to die for!  Hummus is great as is the baba ganoush  Kenefe is our dessert of choice and it's wonderful, perfect ending to a meal there.  My only real complaint is the service is on the slow side, but if you're not in a hurry all is well..

jZSV6Mynb-FJHf2zesItsg.text: We celebrated a birthday with our extended family of 16 on a Friday evening. Great choice. We ordered the family style option and it was absolutely delicious. The entertainment was fun (belly dancing). Great place for kids as well. The only downside was that the waiter was not fully attentive and we had to chase him down for water refills and the kids meals. All in - a fantastic choice.

bSkcIYR9rIKSCA-oU-4C9Q.text: We've eaten at Mijana a few times. Saturday was clearly the worst. Only got service after we stopped a server and asked for service. Not enough staff. They must have a new cook because the plating was very sloppy and the chicken was undercooked in the mixed grill. Hope they get it straightened out.

yRGKOL35EznT1lkWRGFr0Q.text: This place serves food with so much flavor you go away and don't want to eat anything else for days.  What a terrific blend of spice and old-time Lebanese flavoring.  I always eat the Jalapeno Hummus, with fresh bread.  The flavor in the Hummus is amazing, not too hot, but enough bite to get  your senses going.  The fresh pita bread is cooked as you wait, it's fluffy and hot and makes you yearn for the old country.        Let me tell you about the chicken vegetable soup.  It is so good, I have actually never had soup this good.  You will love it.  Served in a cream sauce, lots of chicken and an array of fresh vegetables.  Wow!  The flavors burst in your mouth, coupled with the fresh bread and Hummus, you'll want to eat more, but there will be no room.

qhXdWemsICDJktYrlVqmnw.text: I ordered for delivery and got the baklava for dessert and got the Beirut special for the main course. The special was good to great because there was so much diversity. That baklava though was a fantastic dessert. Heck, I would order from or go there just for that... and my wife would tell you I'm not a dessert person!

NZSqPQqlv47RjzuZc7Trww.text: At first had mixed feelings of how this restaurant would be. The waitress wanted to seat me at a small dark table in the back by the bar and door to the kitchen. There were plenty of seats at the front by the windows. I asked if I could sit up front and selected an open table, she reluctantly agreed.   Once seated it seemed to take awhile before she got back to me with water and a menu. I ordered the Chicken Shawarma and let her know I had a Yelp check in offering a free humus plate.  I'm glad I sat up front where it's light as the meal when served was very colorful and well presented. The yellow chicken Shawarma is served on a bed of yellow rice with a nice salad of lettuce, cucumber and tomato and some crunchy pickled vegetables. At first the Sharma seemed slightly bland but when eating along with the potent creamy garlic sauce it was very good.  The free humus plate was awesome very good humus served with a puddle of oil and a few chick peas on top along with some flaky and hot naan type bread. Very tasty and filling meal.  Make sure to check your bill if you use the free humus plate, they forgot to subtract it. This is a good place to eat. I think they could work on their service . The waitress didn't seem to want or have time to make the guests feel comfortable.

naAQBkZYKR5pmx1DQg0hcQ.text: FILTH, FILTH, FILTH   My wife and I arrived at exactly 5pm on a Saturday.  That is the time they open for dinner.  We were the second customers to arrive.  My wife went to use the restroom, and she came out wanting to vomit.  She states there was urine all over the toilet seat, that had been there for weeks.  So she asks me to check out the men's restroom to see if it was in the same condition.  Sure enough, it was disgusting!  There was urine all over the urinal, urine all over the floor, it stunk like a backed up sewer, and most of all there was urine all in the sink with pubic hairs.  WTH!  My wife makes mention of their current restroom situation to our waitress.  The waitress tells who we assume is the owner/manager of the restaurant of the restrooms condition.  He then makes her (our waitress) clean the lady's restroom.  Then we see the gentleman who makes the pita bread, go and clean the men's restroom.  To top it all off! Our waitress when finished with cleaning the lady's restroom, proceeds to the kitchen area, and places the dirty towel, and cleaning formula, next to the coffee maker.  Some mild mentions.  The beverages taste horrible.  They taste like they come from unfiltered dirty tap water.  The beverages ordered were a diet coke, and an iced-t.  We asked for our bill, paid and left the restaurant.     Mijana!  You need to hire a cleaning crew!  To have filthy restrooms that look like they haven't been cleaned in weeks, is highly unacceptable.  I highly recommend a water filtration system for your beverages.

_aJ74XKSTahVby9O_NiBaA.text: Our sever Zaya was fastastic and friendly.  He brought made a great recommendation on mixed grill chicken, steak, and lamb, rice, and salad. Great tasting food, wonderful atmosphere, and would definitely come back.   On Thursday nights their is Tango dancing which so much fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious and tasty... Taking some home!
Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bread was hot like my date! Complements steak perfectly.
Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. We destroyed it! Very tasty...

Xs154WzK0yzR8_lZVJjBNg.text: Food is amazing and hookah is really Friday nights are the best and the music is good just very chill and relaxing

2itCERSgczcuz8T0d9h2xQ.text: Absolutely excellent. Food is authentic--like Siti made!  Thoughtfully prepared. Extensive menu. Beautifully presented. Service is skilled and friendly. Crowd was mixed--date night, families, single diners--all made to feel welcome. We had a mix--lovely dolmas, lemony hummus, babaganoush (best ever--smokey and flavorful), grilled chicken kabobs--tender inside and crispy outside--fresh bread with sesame spread and pickles--oh my. Brought home leftovers and they were gone this morning by 9 am. Called for reservations mid afternoon and left a message that was returned by owner within an hour. He made rounds of all the tables, checking on food and service--friendly and welcoming. The best.

XYYCnRzpcf5WHNr2tWmHFQ.text: Just completed a cooking class here and loved it! The class had an instructor(Vivian) who was super entertaining and walked us through each dish. Then we got to taste each dish. Then at the end all the left overs were left out with doggie bags so we could take some of the great food home. Also Chardonnay wine was included!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken

ZoS8ON68HGfyQC4wa2bzsw.text: The food was very tasty, definitely took care of a craving. It could have been spiced slightly more, but was very good. The garlic butter/paste that came with the meal was amazing! Will definitely be going back.

ANY5qHvbAYQrCyiB-Ewy9w.text: I came here because I saw a post on Craigslist about salsa lessons and Latin night , nice looking place , hostess and host were very friendly and welcomed me , I grabbed a table by the bar , I ordered at the bar as I didn't see a server , it looked like they were pretty busy so I didn't worry about that , I ordered drinks and food , I took the salsa class , it was fun . Once I got back to my table , I ordered more drinks , went to the dance floor to dance and when I came back I saw a "chair hugger" sneaking my chair , I grabbed it back (having drinks on the table in Arizona apparently means nothing to other people) , I went back to dance on the floor and two men sat on my table , it was kind of weird how no one there wanted to respect that , I got there 1 hour before the craziness started so I would have a place to seat but people seems to not care , I am Colombian , yeah , feisty , so , please be respectful to me or you'll find trouble haha :) I would've never taken other people's chairs , don't do to others what you don't want to be done to you . After having a "talk" to the "the chair hugger" , I wanted to leave , she seemed rude , but I was there to have fun , so I looked for a table by the dj , found one and stayed there for about 2 hours , it was a fun experience besides the bad manners of some . I'm coming back here every week and I'll make sure to be on a place where no one want to seat so I don't have a bad time :)  Food was ok (maybe just what I ordered ) , I recommend the sangria .

SPsgginHMxeF3n88ayAHAg.text: Their rice is amazing! The kabobs, stew and dessert were all amazing too. I would say the rice and dessert were my favorite parts though. The dessert was a pistachio honey ice cream they make homemade on site! Absolutely phenomenal! A bit pricey but worth it!

OlmlPkOIQID4eveoFVIjbA.text: We had a Group On for this place thought we would give it a try.  The atmosphere in the restaurant was what you would expect for a strip mall. A large room with lots of tables and a stage on one end and a bar at the other.  The Food was OK but nothing to go out of your way for.  We ordered two wraps One Gyro with fries One chicken Shawarma with fries  Both had good flavor but not a lot of meat. We ordered the fries extra crispy they were not so good but edible.  Now the worst part was the service. I'm hopping this was a bartender or someone just filling in he should never wait tables again. There were long wait time in between getting things, he had no personalty and didn't seem to care if we were there or not.   I could under stand the lack of attention if they were busy but there were 4 tables at the most in the restaurant. During our meal I watched as our waiter was in the prep area eating and spending time talking with other employees when he should have been taking of tables.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone to go out of there way to try.  Oh well you can't win them all.

0_vBPQ3Y0P7lDZwlSrRqrw.text: The worst service I've ever received at a restaurant. My wife's food came out 20 minutes before mine. I ordered an iced tea, but didn't get it for almost 30 minutes. After we ate our meals we waited another half hour to get our check. The food was okay, but I wouldn't make a special trip to get some. We were ignored for most of our dining experience, while others were taken care of and treated like family. We won't be back.

ntRiBusmQh5wnD6eiMEYiA.text: It was crowded when we arrived this Friday eve.  On Friday and Saturday at 7:30pm, there is live belly dancing.  It took some time for us to figure out what we wanted.  While we perused the menu, our beverages came along with warm pita bread and a nice mixture of olive oil with sesame seeds and some herbs.  We finally decided on Kabob Chicken with rice and salad and a Chicken Shawarma sandwich with fries.  We munched on the warm pits bread and dip while we waited.  This place is vast and great for large parties of people.  There were 5 TV monitors with sports playing, a large bar and a huge room with many tables.  Our food arrived hot and looking tasty.  The Shawarma was very good as was the kabobs.  The salad was fresh and rice aplenty.   We didn't stay for the entertainment but other patrons were arriving for the free show.  Plenty of parking, and nice staff.

ksGTMQ9om-HjCF1CmAIw8Q.text: Checked this out on a Groupon special and so happy! Haven't had good Lebanese in some time and late lunch/early dinner here was a great call.  Service was okay, the food was fantastic. Bread came to the table hot and fresh from the oven.    Just sad I missed the belly dancers...

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mijana Mix Grill for Two

6Xag3rJIP3QB5zNIOySwFQ.text: Came here for dinner on a Monday night but will definitely be back on a Friday or Saturday for the live band + belly dancing.  We got the pita, hummus and zahtar to begin with and it was exceptional!  We also ordered the lentil soup, kofta pita wrap, salad, and the chicken shawarma plate. The kofta, chicken and rice was delicious!   They make their pita fresh daily. You can also tell everything was very fresh.  Will definitely be back.

KLhCj0j_mSaolDZPOb7XEQ.text: I like this place for good food. We went on Friday and there was belly dancing and live music which was really good. The service is so slow like I have never experienced such slow service ever. The owner himself is running around not only attending guests to their table but also serve food and clean tables as when needed. I loved the chicken shawarma which I ordered and the hummus. As we wait for our food they provided us pita bread. Some points about the service which really annoyed. 1. There was no cutlery. 2. The waiter attended us more after more than 10 mins and it wasn't that busy either. 3. Foods came in late but that's okay!  4. It took forever to get the bill so we walked towards the counter and paid there.  A better service will really help this pla

UvDkHRcpDq0_shyhHP8x4w.text: The food is so delicious and the hot tea (Ceylon tea with mint) is so good. We ordered the pot of tea to share. The tea smells so good and it is not too strong nor too weak.  The basket of warm pita bread and dipping sauce to start the meal is so great. The bread here is unique. It is softer but still has firm texture.   I got Majina mix grill for one. It is a plate of rice, salad, and three skewers of beef, chicken, and kofta kebab. The rice is so tasty. It is not too oily and not too many spices but enough to enjoy them. They grilled the meats into perfection. Dipping them with yogurt is making the meat even taste better. The salad and dressing are also fresh and tasty.

LArIE6utDNUaQ1DSCxh37w.text: This place is amazing! If you're looking for great food and entertainment then definitely come here! We went on a Saturday night around 6:30pm and were seated right away.  We ordered drinks and an appetizer and then ordered food.  At 7:30 the belly dancer comes out, she's beautiful and fun and interacts with the audience.  This is a family friendly environment so you can bring children.  The food is amazing and does not take long to come out at all. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Me dancing
Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bread they bring out
Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States

FiiA-wmVBENs41XJS6dZbg.text: Finally got a chance to try this place, and I'm glad we did.  It's a pretty large space inside.  Evidently some nights they move some of the tables and do dancing.    First up was warm pita with dipping sauce.  It was very nice.  The sauce was unique.    We ordered the mixed grill for two. All the items included were very good.  Middle eastern, but slightly different.  Probably regional influences as we were told this is Lebonese. Turkish coffee also very good, and very authentic.  A bit pricey, but we had a dining certificate which made the price reasonable.  We were very happy with our food.  It was quite good, and the service also was very good.  A solid four stars here.

Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mixed grill for two

7eSycrKqiZm-c567BPYNSA.text: Went with my girlfriend she wanted me to try Arabian food. Food was horrible ate chicken it wasn't even cooked well. The kafta was cold and to top it all music was sooo loud and the bold headed singer they have was flirting with my GF which made us feel uncomfortable . Asked for check and left.  Will never return

FRGYCyH3fsVSjQzYAolBzg.text: This place is awesome! A lady friend invited me for dinner a few months back. I never ate this type of food before but now I'm hooked. Every new thing I've tried since I've been there has been perfect! Quick service, clean, and great vibes. I love it!

ZwIBIdI_MDqdvgsqkN-DtQ.text: Hookas..belly dancing.. forget Christmas in July..The chicken kabobs..r bomb..The beef shirma was extradinary..The menu is fit for Kings...The atmosphere is Drasaic..The menu also has everything u could want ...from shrimp to fish..even the salmon jumps out  the water!!...into your mouthThis is one Middle Eastern joint that pops and locks..and Hookas all night long

xnFjDaKExUBljVROPK3Ejg.text: Authentic Lebanese style establishment! Love the extensive menu and they have great fresh pita. Belly dancer was on point and a nice touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ready for some GREAT Lebanese food and dancing

RRPrp5pbMFnJqmiXuAskFQ.text: Well this is an interesting experience to tell you about. We thought the menu looked good, so we gave it a go. When we entered the restaurant there was nobody there to greet or seat us, so after looking around we sat ourselves. The restaurant was long, dark and well visited by a squad of house flies. A waiter came in reasonable time and brought us some pillowy housemade pita bread. It came with a lovely olive oil herb dip. Luckily the bread was folded inside a napkin cause the flies thought it looked good too. I asked the waiter 3 times before he finally "tuned in" to realize I was asking him a question, if we could be moved in order to sit where the flies weren't so bad. He moved us down a bit to place us under a fan. It was a bit better.   I ordered dolmades and a salad that came with a pomegranate maple syrup vinaigrette. It was so scrumptious. The dolmades were good yet different than any I've had. My partner had a lentil bean salad and it too was very tasty. But we both agreed the best part of the whole meal was the homemade pita bread. The inside of the restaurant was in desperate need of a facelift. The heavy red drapes and old worn out chairs were very outdated.... Not to mention the flies, did not lend itself to a pleasant eating atmosphere.   Also, I couldn't tell if the waiter just didn't speak much English, was too busy wearing both the chef hat and waiter's or If was just flat out shy. But I would probably show back up for another taste of hummus or another dish. I'll just make sure I park myself under the fan.

TbcHIUNU2aLoz4UhniYojA.text: DELICIOUS!!! We were given the Arizona restaurant gift card for Christmas and decided to try this place out! I love babaganoush  and how fresh their bread was!! The flavors in each sauce   We tried a few different things along with the platter for 3... so much food for a great price! Can't go wrong here! Just wear your stretchy pants because you can't stop eating everything is too good. Excited to go back for the belly dancing show! Telling all of my friends to go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States

n-wuKLpWBUskVNp9s5iBNQ.text: Not sure why Mijana doesn't have 5 STARS!!  I always visit Mijana (and now their new location Mijana West) when I'm in AZ for work.   The food has so much flavor, the staff is hard working, the entertainment is never lacking, and the owners are always making sure you are taken care of.  Highly recommend making lunch and dinner plans here, especially if you are lucky enough to live near one of their restaurants!!   Mijana, please come to California!

XIjXrcZTMX_dkU2_obukZA.text: I have to update my review. The amount of screeching that is done by the dj is awful and unprofessional. Prepare for your ears to be pierced by the noise.  I'm not sure where our waiter went it's been 25 min since I have had the menu and hasn't showed up.  Save your ears and appetite. You will leave this place deaf and hungry.

dz5oqZaVBDRUzLeihyDFow.text: I went there last week on Valentine's Day with my boyfriend since we both really like Mediterranean food. The restaurant wasn't very busy, I mean, they still had a few tables but it wasn't like I need to make a line and wait for a while busy.  Anyhow, we sat at our table and waited a few minutes to get service after we received our drinks and our order was taken. The food took a really long time and our server hardly checked on us during that time to see if we needed anything else.  Once we received our food, the presentation wasn't the best and neither was the taste. I have had definitely better experiences at other restaurants.  I am not sure if I would go and give it a second try, I would have to try out different Mediterranean restaurants so I can compare food quality and service.

tK84zKJpUcYQRgHx4A3_bQ.text: This place is horrible with bad ownership.  We booked a cooking class and confirmed on the phone with the owner.  We showed up and they said nope- not today!  Talked to the owner and asked for a refund.  He was rude and said nope- I don't care.   I told him it was poor business and I would review accordingly.  His comment "I don't care I like bad reviews" and hung up! Don't waste your time and money here!

ewKJrFjkgt3HMOTGZ8gGdg.text: First timer hoping to get some amazing Lebanese Food.  We ordered the Chicken Biryani,  Chicken kebab sandwich, and Tabbouleh.  We were served complimentary pita bread which was hot & puffed up straight from the oven.  They gave us an olive oil dipping sauce which had basil and different kinds of seeds in it including sesame seeds.  Nice bread and dip!   The biryani presented as some yellow rice at the bottom of the plate and many small pieces of chicken on top.  The chicken looked dry and when we tried it it was super dry.  Hubby said, "I can't it this, I won't eat this".  Wow. Usually he makes due with his dishes but after I tasted it, I realized how right he was!  The dish was exchanged gracefully by the server who explained that the chicken is cooked first and then it is cooked a second time when it is time to serve.  That explains it!  In its stead,  we ordered the ground meat kebab which came with yellow rice and a salad--a Much better dish.    The tabbouleh was really good.  The chicken sandwich, wrapped in a warm pita, was good & fresh, but the chicken lacked flavor.  Chicken has to marinate in spices and herbs for at least 24 hours if you are to get any type of flavorful meat when you grill it.  I ate most of it but the motivation to finish it was not there.  The chicken I did eat I did so because I dipped it into the yogurt sauce they served with the meal which was really good.  But the chicken should stand on its own without any add on's.  Later in the evening, a belly dancer began her performance and it is too bad that most people were chatting away and not really paying attention.  She did her best to entertain the crowd.   Food wise, Mijana should improve its flavor profile especially on the meats and of course overcooking meat is a sin of great proportions.

photos.caption: Photo of Mijana - Tempe, AZ, United States

A3PwJkiVGyh1r6p-PBzI3g.text: I went here for my friend's birthday celebration. The belly dancer was a fun experience. The food, well, meh. It was ok but not great. I had a falafel sandwich and they didn't put any sauce on it. When I asked for sauce, they pretended like it didn't come on it but the kitchen was going to make some for me. I think they were out and trying to avoid actually making any thinking I wouldn't know better. They did get me sauce, but by that time everything was cold. The fries were not great.

wzjdoUyR4LlgJiDkfDlD-Q.text: Three stars because of burnt food and horrible waitress service.  We stopped in here a couple weeks ago. I think it's the 2nd time we've been there. The first time we were the only ones in the restaurant, the food was fantastic and our service good.   We ordered rice, hummus, garlic sauce, a gyro with salad, the chicken and fries children's meal and two drinks.   After serving us, our waitress disappeared. Thus we couldn't ask her for drink refills. It was pretty obvious the chicken on the children's meal was burnt when it was sat down but after we had a minute to look at it we realized it wasn't something that could be eaten it was so bad.   Again, no waitress. After about an hour, I got up from the table and wondered over to the kitchen where I watched two people talking. One of them was preparing bread for a couple that just came in.   I asked for an invoice. The woman who was preparing the bread had to get a male who appeared to the manager to tally our bill. When she came to give us the bill at the table she glanced down at the $7.99 chicken dinner and said "oh, that's burnt." We agreed but we were still charged for it.   I asked her where our waitress was and why we never had a drink refill as I gave her my charge card. No answer. As we were preparing to leave the original waitress rushed in the front door.   I have no clue where she was but obviously  if she left someone should have come to check on our table.

jh-BvByz1oW44DQpo_2NOA.text: So good on so many levels. I got a nice plate with about everything for a little over $15. It was worth it. I am in town alone but wish I had others to share how good this food and atmosphere is.  The place is traditional Lebanese. Owner is and runs it well.

aWHmvPQOZn1nwvvCvHTeww.text: Offers in their websites in no longer valid! But they keep it to drag you in! Server is bad. Management need to do a lot of changes if they wanna keep the business up.

CSMELiO66p5hzDJSrdPKsA.text: This is my second review in which this place deserved another update! The food was very fresh! Tasted fantastic! They had a few things off only on the order!!  If the picture shows it as a single order! I believe that's exactly what I should be getting! But this place came back out and brought me more because he tried to make up for it! Thank You! It means a lot!!!  I hate that the printed sheet they get does not print out all the information they should get? I put things in there that this restaurant did not get in the print out sheet! I read it! Things were missing!  Yelp's got to get that together! All this time I thought it was the restaurant not reading the FULL ORDER!!! YELP NEEDS TO MAKE SURE all the extras that are requested are in there!!! Thx! 10/1/16  My first time enjoying this place!  Forgot a few things in my order...Lentil soup was very good...Dolmas was good but a lot smaller than the pictures! they forgot the gyro and salad...brought back the gyro but no salad...he said he was doing his best! After I paid for what I ordered! Win some lose some!

F8YDVD0NKLMqzROMorTNHQ.text: The staff was not friendly and helpful at all. She would take for ever to come back and ask for order also bring the food. We chose 3 different foods and she came back 15 minutes after taking the orders to let us know one of the foods is not available while she brought the other 2 foods !! And finally when she brought my friends salad she spilled the salad juice on my friends pants ! Not satisfied at all and will not be back !

wuqUjxjyEjJVDfp3i8szaA.text: I've never had Lebanese food before, but a co-worker highly recommended Mijana. I was a bit hesitant, since there are so many phenomenal food choices in Tempe. The menu was easy to read, as there were photos next to the descriptions. For starters, the complementary pita bread was hot, fresh, airy and delicious. The bread went perfect with the Jalapeno hummus, which wasn't overly spicy. The kebabs in my entree were also perfect. The steak was tender, juicy, and perfectly cooked. The portions were very generous and the prices were reasonable. This is a great restaurant if you want to stray a bit from your comfort zone. You won't be disappointed!

nfr0KbqqinVB9b925mVlew.text: My wife blindfolded me, took me for a ride and told me I was getting a surprise dinner that night. When I was unmasked, it was excited to try cuisine I never had before. I could not stop eating the fresh baked bread with the olive oil mix.  I had some kind of combination meat dish and each was cooked perfectly. Great service, reasonable prices. I think I'm going to go again this week.

yaY264Eygg45zt-yBPq6WA.text: We decided to try this place out since they offered the yelp check-in deal. The pita bread & dip they brought out before our meal was a tasty start. The waitress was pleasant & came out with drinks. I ordered the chicken shwarma platter as it was recommended to us. The chicken was really tasty & well-cooked and the rice wasn't too bad. Personally, I could've done without the salad. The waitress again came by and brought out a platter with dessert options. We ordered one which took way too long to come out and wasn't anything to rave about. Overall, it was an ok meal.

Av23dH2jVQViZTeRo0ZgIA.text: This was the best Mediterranean food I have had in the Phoenix area. If you are around, don't miss it if you like Mediterranean food. Freshly baked pita are second to none and the sauce they come with, you gotta try them to know what awesomeness i'm talking about.

fzPbJI80rqV8WDk9LepdjA.text: "Is there anything else we can help you with?" We were asked this question repeatedly Friday night. Arriving for a 7:30pm reservation we had our pick of tables as there weren't many diners. Given the choice we eagerly sat in an available booth. We both sat on the cushioned seating against the wall. Given our experience I'd recommend sticking with standard chairs, for reasons you may, or may not agree with. "Are you ready to order?" Belly dancing is from 7-9pm (ended earlier). A wonderful show is put on near the stage. Tables in the center part of the restaurant (and the booths) have prime viewing. As this was my first visit I fastidiously reviewed the drink menu. To my delight there was a curious mix of drinks available. Margaritas. Long Island Ice Teas. Martinis. Jagermeister - Yeah. That was on there. As a drink. Neat. Nothing quite traditional sounding so I went with wine. In the meantime a glass of water was brought out. "Can we help you?" "Are you ready to order?" Erm- We'd just opened the drink menus. Not quite. I explained this was my first visit. Hoping to hear something, anything. a handout to what a mezza might be, instead I heard. "I would recommend ordering the Mixed Grill for Two...It has mwah mwah mwah mwah" said incredibly fast. I blinked. She said the name of another dish quickly. I blinked. And then - "Do you need a few more minutes?" Yes. I suppose so. 36 seconds later - We opted to try the Vegetarian Platter (huge) as an appetizer. Hummus, Babaghanouj, Tabbouleh, (3) Falafel and (3) Vegetarian Dolmades. That's plenty of food to share with four people. Ambitious for two. We were granted time to deliberate our entree order a few more minutes. Instead of the Mixed Grill shared plate (which sounded interesting: skewers of Chicken Kebab, Kefta Kebob and Lamb Kebob) Lamb tempted us. Specifically Lamb Shank and Lamb Kebabs. The menu is separated into cold and hot mezzas. We made out like bandits quickly picking what we did. The food is stellar here. At this point we began an interesting game I'll call "Moving of the Plates and Glasses". We were curious what our entrees might taste like once they were dropped at the table. So we got up and moved them from the far side of the table. You know, within fork reach. Then we slid the appetizer platter out. And the bread plate. And our empty water glasses. And my wine carafe. And the empty beer bottle. (Later I had an even larger collection of glassware.) Where did everyone go? That's ok. I was distracted by the Fred Flinstone sized portion of my True to description, falling off the bone, lamb. Honest to god, I almost died. But then - oh - my date reached suddenly behind my head with his napkin. His expression frozen with intent. I paused in only what second date behavior in public warranted. "Oh? Everything ok?" "Uh. There was ... a .. bug." (IT WAS RIGHT BY MY HAIR. In the dark.) Later I asked my date to describe the bug. It's Arizona. These things happen. He said it could have waved at me. I have little hands. It was bigger than the tip of my thumb. (Also, it apparently got away.) I recommend stand alone seating. FOOD The Lamb Shank shocked me in sheer size. When I poked it with my fork gingerly the meat sighed. The grilled vegetables were delightfully seasoned, grilled and layered on top of a wonderful bed of rice. I wish I had grabbed an appropriate photo of the Lamb Shank. This is a dude's platter. Not for a girl on a date! THINGS TO KNOW + Service is hit or miss. I finally flagged down a very nice man (possibly a manager) for my 2nd glass of water. + Salsa lessons Fri/Sat night. Lights go off. Disco balls goes on. + Baklava is bone dry and hard. It was difficult to break into bite sized pieces. We returned it. + Turkish coffee is divine! + Time your dinner well before dance class. Service ...changed as dance class preparations began. DANCE HERE + It's a happening spot. When I left there was a line outside the door and beefy bouncers. Inside spectator watching (almost) made the service level worth it. + $5 Drink specials! + Friday Night Salsa is produced by AZSalsa.net "Tumbao | Latin Fridays". + Come dressed to impress!

GfCQtN1NLsZ18rRePU70yQ.text: We have eaten at many Middle eastern restaurants and this is right up there with the best. Food was fresh, and tasty. Service was very good, and the belly dancers were a nice bonus. Overall we really enjoyed this place and will come back the next time we are in Phoenix.

f4nbrRj2nS-WtdGl8E9RDg.text: This place is wonderful. Went with a couple friends and got some delicious food with freshly baked pita bread and a cold beer.   Got a hookah and chatted on the patio. Comfortable setting. Nice staff. My new favorite restaurant in the area.

7ysVPEua-Pb0Ikr5Lt6Idg.text: Let me start with I Love Mediterranean food!!   This place has amazing fresh food with entertainment.  They have a belly dancer that dances while you eat and randomly select people to join them dance.  Lol. Really fun to watch. Love their chicken shawarma with rice, hummus, salads, pita breads etc.

C6QWthVZWysQTcqt75Yj0w.text: Great friendly service. The best fresh pita bread I've ever had! The food is very tasty

wUZNXPwBE4rcTGdRTFwUUg.text: If you enjoy ethnic cuisine you must try this place. The service was very attentive and friendly despite taking place on a Saturday evening. The food was delicious and portions were large. Wife and I shared the traditional hummus which came with tahini sauce and homemade pita. It was delicious. We then enjoyed kibbe which is fried beef croquette with beef, pine nuts and onions. OMG! You need to try it.We had their moussaka which is eggplant, zucchini, potatoes,  chickpeas cooked in tomato sauce and served over balsamic rice. Again, really delicious.  Treat yourself by going here.

k-0XYezyFo6xZUZchUG6eQ.text: Decided to drive out to Tempe to try Mijana after getting a coupon and that we all love Lebanese/Greek food. Went there on a Friday night with our toddler son. It was quite busy and they let us know food was 45 minutes out. Not a problem. We ordered apps which came timely along with their hot bread. Then we see things happening...there is belly dancing on the weekends that we didn't know about. It went on until well after we got our food and our son was mesmerized by it. Didn't complain once about being in the high chair for almost an hour but kept his focus on the dancer. And he ate a lot!  All the food we had was amazing (we shared a platter for 2) along with the Tzaiki app (best I've had and it was so fresh) and the hummus app (amazing). When we were leaving they were moving tables as they have Salsa dancing too!  We will definitely return for the food and entertainment. The only downside was the wait for the check and to go boxes after finishing.

E2y7ZCZROE1kJ7Pss2nUaA.text: Don't do the cooking class, but do eat here!!   I bought a Groupon for a date night, we love to cook! However, the cooking class was not as I expected/hoped. The class was a demonstration and then serving pre made foods. There were a lot of people and we were seated in the back, in combination with their soft voices, I had no idea what was happening. We were hoping to be more interactive. They also didn't let us know when the class was "done", so many stayed to wait for dessert. But there was none.  However, everything we ate was AMAZING. They completely changed my opinion on eggplants. Previously I hated them and was very intimidated to try anything with eggplant in them. Their baba ganouj was fantastic with their homemade naan (also amazing). They used a hint of cinnamon in their shawarma, which was great and paired perfectly with a tart garlic sauce. I would also recommend their hummus and tabouli.  Now the desserts were by far my favorite. Baklava is one of my favorite desserts, so I may be biased. I wanted to try some new desserts and ordered creme caramel and the knafe. Both were awesome!   I would highly recommend this restaurant for eating but I would not recommend the cooking class.

SE7JKWUpuFQzj-YvjXXReA.text: Wow, what a meal.  That was sooooo good.  We both ate chicken swarma and it was awesome.  Comes with a salad and rice.  Also has an awesome garlic sauce.  There is alot of food, all of it fresh.  The meal comes with freh baked pita bread.  The bread is baked right there in a brick oven.  Big, fluffy and nicely browned.  The bread comes with this dipping sauce with oregano, sumac, sesame seeds, olive oil and some other spices.  Our waitress (gastronomic tour guide) Lydia was very sweet and took the time to explain what everything was.  They also told us that some weekends they have live music and belly dancing.  This place was very much a do over for us!  Thanks Lydia and the rest of the people at Mijana.

6ZGrHfNXqJC0htl5vDWPpA.text: The food was great but the service was awful. I went here with a friend who raved about it and has never had an issue before. Everything started out fine, we were served by Zaya who was nice enough to turn off a fan above the table for us as we were cold. My friend ordered a plate and asked for no vegetables but the plate came out with vegetables. It was just a mistake, not an issue. The server went back to the kitchen and brought it back but it was very obvious that they had just scraped off the veggies and put rice over it. This would have been fine except they didn't scrape it all off. Underneath the rice was multiple big chunks of vegetables that they had just put rice over and the dish was cold. We then waited for 10+ minutes beckoning for the server and waiting for him to come back over to the table to request that they scrape all of the vegetables off. He very blatantly did not serve us even though he was serving tables around us. Finally, she got up and walked over to him asking that he fix the dish. Zaya returned to the kitchen with the dish and said that they would be making us a new one. When the new one came out, it was good but when the server had taken the last dish he had also taken the silverware. We waited for him to come back over so we could get new silverware but again, he did not wait on us. At this point, I was also out of water and wanted a refill but Zaya had not once come over to our table. He waited on tables all around us but not our table. After 15-20 minutes, he came back over and we finally asked for silverware though at this point we wanted to leave so we asked for boxes and the checks as well. When Zaya brought out the checks he went out of his way to tell us that the vegetables on the plate were not his fault and make sure we knew it was the kitchens fault. He had taken a picture on his phone of the order he had put in which had said no vegetables and showed us the picture. Until that moment, we had both still been fine. Slightly annoyed at the service but the vegetables on the plate hadn't been a big deal. The food was delicious and we watched the live dancing which was a lot of fun. Kitchens make mistakes and we understand that isn't the servers fault but in this situation, our bad experience was at no fault of the kitchen. It was the service. Furthermore going out of your way to make sure the blame is on someone else does not bode well. We had no issues with anything else except for our service and would still go back.

6RgRbH87VYV6pwGkbV6ZZw.text: Went here because we bought the living social deal. This place was AMAZING!  My husband and I shared the schwarma combo and it was more than enough food. Everything about the combo was fantastic and extremely flavorful. I like extra cucumbers, so I ordered the side of tomatoes and cucumbers, which made the meal just perfect for me. I also ordered the mango smoothie with amaretto. It was served in a tall glass  and you can bet it was empty by the time I was done. You will be so happy you tried this place! I even enjoyed the music and atmosphere on a Friday night  ((Good Friday). We missed the belly dancing at 730, but we were done eating by 845, and the restaurant was just starting to pick up because they were having salsa dancing lessons later!
